src:
Etape Pertama Tour De Singkarak Sukses Tanpa Rintangan
02 Nov 2019, 22:17 by Ahmat Ikhsan



Etape Pertama Tour De Singkarak Sukses Tanpa Rintangan



Etape Pertama Tour De Singkarak Sukses Tanpa Rintangan


KBRN, Tanah Datar: Pelaksanaan Tour de Singkarak 2019 dietape pertama hari ini, Sabtu (2/11/2019) berjalan lancar.  Sejak start di pantai gandoriah kota pariaman dengan  menempuh rute sepanjang 107,3 km hingga finish di istano basa pagaruyuang kabupaten tanah datar, tidak terjadi kendala .108 pebalap dari 18 team  ikut serta  menempuh lintas bervariasi,  dengan  dukungan   tim pengamanan yang baik.   Estimasi waktu finish berlangsung  lebih cepat  dari schedule awal yang  ditentukan pada pukul 13.31 wib. Rice Director Tour de Singkarak Mr Jamaludin Mahmood mengatakan pihaknya juga  mendapatkan tanggapan positif dari komisaris UCI atas kelancaran etape pertama di  event berskala internasional yang telah 11 kaki dilaksanakan di ranah minang ini. 
"Bagi perkiraan saya, itu amat bagus ya,apalagi  selesai lomba komisaris internasional dari UCI datang kepada saya, hari ini etape pertama bagus berjalan lancar, pengamanan lintasan cukup baik,” ujar Jamaludin Mahmood. Di etape 1 ini,  tim Sapura Cycling  mampu unggul dengan waktu tercepat 02.34.50 melalui Jesse Ewart,  disusul rekan satu timnya Cristian Raileanu dengan selisih waktu  5 detik,  sedangkan Thanakhan Chaiyasombat  dari Thailand Continental Cycling Team yang  tertinggal 2.35 detik dari Jesse Ewart hanya mampu  menempati podium 3  untyk individual general classification by time atau yellow jersey.  Untuk Best Indonesian Rider  "Red and White Jersey diraih Agung Sahbana dari KFC team dengan waktu 02.37.33, sedangkan best sprinter  classification green jersey juga didapatkan Jesse Ewart  dengan 21 point, termasuk best climber's classification - king of montain  polka dot jersey dengan 13 point.Dijadwalkan besok pagi,  Minggu (3/11/2019) etape 2 akan  dilaksanakan dengan  start di Depan Kantor Bupati Pasaman, lubuk sikaping menempuh lintasan sepanjang 112, 2 km  hingga finish di jam gadang kota  bukittinggi. Tercatat pada Tour de Singkarak tahun ini,  dua tim telah mengundurkan diri yakni Sri lanka dan Australia.
text:
First Stage of Tour De Singkarak Success Without Obstacles
02 Nov 2019, 22:17 by Ahmat Ikhsan



First Stage of Tour De Singkarak Success Without Obstacles



First Stage of Tour De Singkarak Success Without Obstacles


KBRN, Tanah Datar: Implementation of Tour de Singkarak 2019 The first diet today, Saturday (11/2/2019) went smoothly. Since starting at the gandoriah beach of Pariaman City by taking a route along 107.3 km to finish in istano basa pagaruyuang flat land district, there were no obstacles. 108 racers from 18 teams participated in varying crossings, with the support of a good security team. Estimated finish time is faster than the initial schedule specified at 13:31 pm. Rice Director of the Tour de Singkarak Mr. Jamaludin Mahmood said that his party also received a positive response from the UCI commissioner for the smooth running of the first stage at an international scale event which has been held 11 minutes in this realm of Minang.
"For my estimation, it was very good, especially since the international commissioner competition from UCI came to me, today the first stage was good, the track was good," Jamaludin Mahmood said. In Stage 1, the Sapura Cycling team was able to excel with fastest time 02.34.50 through Jesse Ewart, followed by his teammate Cristian Raileanu with a difference of 5 seconds, while Thanakhan Chaiyasombat from Thailand Continental Cycling Team who left 2.35 seconds from Jesse Ewart was only able to occupy the podium 3 for individual general classification by time or yellow jersey For the Best Indonesian Rider "Red and White Jersey won by Agung Sahbana from the KFC team with a time of 02.37.33, while the best sprinter classification of green jersey was also obtained by Jesse Ewart with 21 points, including best climber's classification - king of montain polka dot jersey with 13 points . Scheduled tomorrow morning, Sunday (3/11/2019) Stage 2 will be held Ksanakan, with a start in front of the Pasaman Regent's Office, Lubuk Siking took a 112 km track and finished at the Clock Tower of Bukittinggi City. Noted on the Tour de Singkarak this year, two teams have resigned, namely Sri Lanka and Australia.
